title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ORLANDO — On a night where the basket must have looked as wide as the ocean, Tracy McGrady authored a performance for the ages, single-handedly lifting the Orlando Magic to a bruising 92-87 victory over the Toronto Raptors.

From the opening tip, it was clear something special was brewing. McGrady, with a breathtaking combination of athleticism and grace, poured in a staggering 62 points, a total so monumental it dwarfed the rest of the game's narrative. He was unstoppable, a force of nature slicing through the Raptors' defense with an arsenal of drives, pull-ups, and thunderous dunks. Each possession became a must-watch event, the Orlando Arena crowd rising in anticipation every time the ball found its way into his hands.

While McGrady’s historic scoring barrage was the undisputed headline, the game was a grind. The Raptors, led by Doug Christie’s 18 points, fought valiantly, their defense scrambling to find any answer for the onslaught. Yet, for all their effort, they could never fully contain the tidal wave of offense coming from one man.

The contest tightened in the final minutes, the scoreboard a testament to the gritty, defensive struggle that framed McGrody's individual brilliance. But with the game hanging in the balance, it was inevitably McGrady who seized control, hitting clutch shot after clutch shot to silence the Raptors' final push. His 62 points were not just a number; they were the story, the reason, and the final, emphatic answer in a classic NBA battle.
